an8.8:8.7: “Well then, Lord of Gods, I shall give you a simile.
an8.8:8.8: For by means of a simile some sensible people understand the meaning of what is said.
an8.8:9.1: Suppose there was a large heap of grain not far from a town or village.
an8.8:9.2: And a large crowd were to take away grain
an8.8:9.3: with carrying poles, baskets, hip sacks, or their cupped hands.
an8.8:9.4: If someone were to go to that crowd and ask them
an8.8:9.5: where they got the grain from, how should that crowd rightly reply?”
an8.8:9.6: “Sir, they should reply that they took it from the large heap of grain.”
an8.8:9.7: “In the same way, Lord of Gods, whatever is well spoken is spoken by the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
an8.8:9.8: Both myself and others bring that up again and again when we speak.”
